articles.author: Jamie Carter
articles.title: This month's 'blood moon' eclipse mirrors one Christopher Columbus used to scare indigenous people with in 1504 - Space.com
articles.description: On March 13-14, 2025, skywatchers in the Americas will witness a total lunar eclipse that mirrors one Christopher Columbus is said to have used to his advantage over five centuries ago.
articles.content: In 1504, Christopher Columbus, on his fourth trans-Atlantic voyage, was stranded on the shores of Jamaica, with his ships crawling with marine worms and his crew hungry. The Indigenous Arawak people,… [+2836 chars]
